intro: Afroligusticum thodei, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Afroligusticum thodei is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes, though its toxic properties should be approached with caution.
